docs.snippet: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 18 (AP) -- Four professional stars and an amateur knocked a stroke off women's par at the Bayshore golf course today to finish the first eighteen holes of the $5,000 Serbin women's invitation tournament tied for the lead.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 18 (AP) -- Four professional stars and an amateur knocked a stroke off women's par at the Bayshore golf course today to finish the first eighteen holes of the $5,000 Serbin women's invitation tournament tied for the lead.

headline.main: 5 WOMEN TIE AT 73 FOR LEAD IN GOLF; Mrs. Zaharias Among 4 Pros Even With Miss Colby as Serbin Tourney Starts

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 18 -- A $1,100,000 assistance program for children in Latin America will be recommended to the executive board of the United Nations Children's Fund, Maurice Pate, executive director of the agency, announced today.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Feb. 18 -- A $1,100,000 assistance program for children in Latin America will be recommended to the executive board of the United Nations Children's Fund, Maurice Pate, executive director of the agency, announced today.

headline.main: AID IN AMERICAS URGED; U. N. Child Agency Will Propose Projects in Latin Lands

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 17 -- There are strong indications that the United States will be much on the defensive at the tenth Inter-American Conference opening March 1 in Caracas, Venezuela.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Feb. 17 -- There are strong indications that the United States will be much on the defensive at the tenth Inter-American Conference opening March 1 in Caracas, Venezuela.

headline.main: SNAGS AT CARACAS FOR U. S. FORESEEN; Latin Americas' Fear Over Aid and Wariness on Reds Evident as Talks Near

docs.snippet: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 19 (AP) -- Patty Berg started and finished poorly but still managed to shoot a two-under-par 72 today to move into the lead at the halfway point in the $5,000 Serbin women's invitation golf tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 19 (AP) -- Patty Berg started and finished poorly but still managed to shoot a two-under-par 72 today to move into the lead at the halfway point in the $5,000 Serbin women's invitation golf tournament.

headline.main: MISS BERG LEADS SERBIN GOLF FIELD; Shoots 2-Under-Par 72 for Total of 145 -- Miss Suggs Second, Miss Rawls Third

docs.snippet: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 20 (AP) -- Mrs. Mildred (Babe) Zaharias tied men's par at the Bayshore golf course today to share the lead with Patty Berg of Chicago in the $5,000 Serbin women's tournament.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI BEACH, Fla., Feb. 20 (AP) -- Mrs. Mildred (Babe) Zaharias tied men's par at the Bayshore golf course today to share the lead with Patty Berg of Chicago in the $5,000 Serbin women's tournament.

headline.main: Mrs. Zaharias and Patty Berg Share Golf Lead; TOP TWO AT 220 AFTER 54 HOLES

docs.snippet: Secretary of State Dulles gave himself (inescapably, to be sure) very little time to prepare for the Tenth Inter-American Conference which opens in Caracas a week from today. By the time he has finished reporting to Congress and the public on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary of State Dulles gave himself (inescapably, to be sure) very little time to prepare for the Tenth Inter-American Conference which opens in Caracas a week from today. By the time he has finished reporting to Congress and the public on the Berlin meeting he will be packing to fly down to Venezuela, where he will face problems as complex and acute as any he had in Berlin.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 -- United States officials made available today confidential figures on the free world's consumer goods exports to the Soviet Union as evidence that the much-publicized Soviet drive to buy Western consumer goods is more fiction...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 -- United States officials made available today confidential figures on the free world's consumer goods exports to the Soviet Union as evidence that the much-publicized Soviet drive to buy Western consumer goods is more fiction than fact.
docs.abstract: US gives data showing USSR estimate of $250-million consumer goods buying in West in '53 exaggerated; total vol down 1/3 despite some rise in consumer goods; figures

headline.main: Soviet Import Plan Discounted by U. S.; IMPORTS BY SOVIET MINIMIZED BY U. S.

byline.original: By DANA ADAMS SCHMIDTSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 24 (AP) -Rain and wind hampered firstround play in the international mixed two-ball golf tournament today.
docs.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 24 (AP) -Rain and wind hampered firstround play in the international mixed two-ball golf tournament today.

headline.main: MRS. SMITH GAINS ON ORLANDO LINKS; She and Bolesta Score Over Betty Bush and Drake by 4 and 2 in Rain, Wind

docs.snippet: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 25 (AP) -- Edean Anderson of Helena, Mont., and Dick Chapman of Pinehurst, N. C., survived the first round of the international mixed two-ball golf tournament today, then turned in the best performance of the day in the second...
docs.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 25 (AP) -- Edean Anderson of Helena, Mont., and Dick Chapman of Pinehurst, N. C., survived the first round of the international mixed two-ball golf tournament today, then turned in the best performance of the day in the second round.

headline.main: EDEAN ANDERSON ADVANCES IN GOLF; She and Chapman Capture 2 Orlando Matches as Miss Berg's Team Also Gains

docs.snippet: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 26 (AP) -- Mrs. Grace DeMoss Smith of Miami and George Bolesta of Tampa, medalists Tuesday, reached the semi-finals of the international mixed two-ball golf tournament with a 3-and-2 victory today over Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg,...
docs.lead_paragraph: ORLANDO, Fla., Feb. 26 (AP) -- Mrs. Grace DeMoss Smith of Miami and George Bolesta of Tampa, medalists Tuesday, reached the semi-finals of the international mixed two-ball golf tournament with a 3-and-2 victory today over Betsy Rawls of Spartanburg, S. C., and Skip Alexander of St. Petersburg.

headline.main: MRS. SMITH'S DUO GAINS SEMI-FINALS; Defeats Miss Rawls' Tandem, 3 and 2, in Mixed Golf Tourney at Orlando
